questions.question_text:
A consultant wants to optimize data loads by extracting Salesforce objects using independent Tableau CRM dataflows ahead of time.
Which construct should be used to accomplish this?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
You use Data sync to load object before dataflow is run.
Weird one. BUt i'd say it is B
The correct construct that should be used to optimize data loads by extracting Salesforce objects using independent Tableau CRM dataflows ahead of time is B. Dataflow.

Selected Answer: C
you are right, Data Sync is ok

Selected Answer: C
agreed with Pulse3. "ahead of time" is the keyword here. even though the question seems odd.

Selected Answer: C
Nope, The answer is C. Why would you use Augment if you want to reduce data loads ahead of time?
Nope, The answer is C. Why would you use Augment if you want to reduce data loads ahead of time?

Selected Answer: D
Augment

D. Augment is the correct answer.
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.bi_integrate_augment_transformation.htm&type=5

comments.content:
I don't understand why the letter D is the correct answer, but I guess the keyword in the question is "independent". I understand we should have concurrent dataflow runs, and then augment the datasets. Is it?

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?language=en_US&id=release-notes.rn_bi_integrate_more_concurrent_dataflow_runs.htm&type=5&release=220

discussion.content: Option D

choices.B: 1 measure, 1 grouping by a date field, and either 0-1 groupings by a dimension if trellis is disabled, or 0-2 groupings if trellis is enabled
choices.D: measure, 1-2 groupings if trellis is disabled, or 1-4 groupings if trellis is enabled
choices.A: 1 measure, 0 groupings if trellis is disabled, or 0-2 groupings if trellis is enabled
choices.C: 2 measures, 0-2 groupings if trellis is disabled, or 0-4 groupings if trellis is enabled

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I think B is the correct answer, as we need 1 measure (Count of Rows), 1 grouping (Year-Month) by a date field (Last Activity), and 0 trellis for the chart we see in the question. 

I understand trellis is used to display a separate chart for each group. Because the charts in a trellis have the same scale, you can quickly compare results across all groups. And in this case, we don't need that. 

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.bi_chart_reference_trellis.htm&type=5
https://www.salesforceblogger.com/2017/11/19/hack-for-date-groupings-in-static-steps/

Selected Answer: B
1 measure (count of rows), 1 grouping (year-month)

Selected Answer: B
B indeed

B
To create a timeline chart to visualize the evolution of Closed Won Opportunities, we would typically need a date field (such as the close date) as a grouping and a measure that we want to track over time (such as the count of Closed Won Opportunities).
If trellis is disabled, we can have zero or one groupings by a dimension, such as the sales region, product line, or sales representative. If trellis is enabled, we can have up to two additional groupings, such as the sales stage or the opportunity type, which would create multiple charts (trellis) based on the combination of those dimensions.
Does anyone understand what they mean with "groupings"? My understanding is that the vertical Y-axis is the measure and the horizontal X-axis is the dimension.
Question was on exam 21 August 2022.

choices.D: No. Einstein Discovery is impervious to collinearity, so the story and subsequent model will be fine.
choices.A: Yes. If the collinear variables are not removed, the Einstein Discovery model build will fail.
choices.C: No. Although it is ideal to eliminate collinearity as soon as possible, Einstein will give a warning post-build, and the ridge regression will prevent collinearity from overfitting.
choices.B: Yes. If all collinear variables are not excluded, the model will overfit and not make any sense.

discussion.content: C is the correct option here

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer. 

Overfitting
In predictive analytics, overfitting occurs when a model performs well in predicting outcomes on the training data in the dataset, but less well when predicting outcomes for other data, such as production data. Using too many explanatory variables can result in an overly complex predictive model that captures the noise in your data. To mitigate overfitting, Einstein Discovery uses ridge regression and regularization. 

You will receive a warning, but can still continue executing your build story. 

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.bi_edd_glossary.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: C
Correct!
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.bi_edd_prep_data_issues.htm&type=5#:~:text=of%20collinear%20variables.-,Collinearity,-occurs%20when%20two

questions.question_text:
When creating a story in Einstein Discovery, a client is wondering if all potential collinear fields need to be removed before executing the build story.
What would accurately answer the client's question?

choices.A: Use a permission set license with two different levels of access.
choices.D: Grant "Manage" access permission to the apps.
choices.B: Create a permission set license assignment with two different levels of access.
choices.C: Create two permission sets with different system permissions.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer, as they already have the correct license (no need for a permission set license, excluding alternatives A and B). They need to keep the same profile but have extended user functional access. Some users need to have the "Create and Edit CRM Analytics Dashboards" user permission, and others the "Use CRM Analytics" user permission. Below you can see the difference between Permission Set License and Permission Set. 

"Permission sets and permission set licenses have different purposes. Read on to save yourself some trouble later.
Permission set licenses extend the functionality of user licenses. With permission set licenses, you can assign more permissions to users than their user license supports.
Permission sets extend users’ functional access without changing their profiles."

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.users_permissionset_licenses_about.htm&type=5
C is the correct one here

I believe C is the correct answer based on this link:

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.bi_setup_enable_create_permset.htm&type=5

questions.question_text:
A Tableau CRM consultant is asked to help a company report on their sales activity. The company wants to train some users to create dashboards. They also want another team to only be able to use the dashboards.
What must be configured to address these requirements?

choices.A: Microsoft Azure SQL Data Warehouse Connector

questions.question_text:
The Universal Containers company uses a Microsoft Azure SQL Data Warehouse to gather information about sales representatives' objectives. They want to use
Einstein Analytics to gain insights from this data; therefore, they need to automatically load the warehouse's data into a Tableau CRM dataset on a daily basis.
The data also needs to be transformed and merged with data from the company's org.
Which three Tableau CRM user interface features can be used to complete these requirements? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABC
I think the correct answers are A, B and C. In the question it reads "user interface features", therefore Analytics REST API is NOT correct, as it is a programmatic feature. 

Tableau CRM Connect for Excel gives you a fast, easy way to import data from Excel 2013 into CRM Analytics. Therefore, it's also incorrect, because there's no mention about Excel in the question.

Data can be transformed and merged with Recipes and Dataflows, and we can use the Microsoft Azure SQL Data Warehouse Connector to retrieve data from the Data Warehouse. Therefore, alternatives A, B and C seems to be correct.

Microsoft Azure SQL Data Warehouse Connector (SQL DW) is an old name, now it's Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics Connection, as you can read here: https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.bi_integrate_connectors_microsoft_azure_sql_dw_settings.htm&type=5
ABC is the correct one here

B. Recipes: Recipes can be used to transform the data as per the requirements and load it into a Tableau CRM dataset.
C. Dataflow: Dataflow can be used to merge the data from the Azure SQL Data Warehouse with the data from the company's org.
E. Analytics REST API: Analytics REST API can be used to automate the process of loading data into the Tableau CRM dataset on a daily basis.

A and D are not relevant for loading and transforming data from Azure SQL Data Warehouse into Tableau CRM dataset. Tableau CRM Connector for Excel is used to connect Tableau CRM data to Excel, and Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics Connection is used to connect Tableau CRM to Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics.
Question was on exam 21 August 2022.

exam.name: Certified Tableau CRM and Einstein Discovery Consultant
